indexPageTextBlock1.intro: Experience the stories of Igor, Tabea, and Jonas on an interactive journey through the often invisible consequences of human actions.
indexPageTextBlock1.rulesText: click on the animations to continue following the stories.
indexPageTextBlock1.tipText: pay attention to recurring elements or places that connect the everyday lives of our protagonists.
indexPageTextBlock1.greeting: Three lives. One place. Welcome to Bültenweg 12! We're glad you're here.

cozy.content: Hedgehogs need small hiding spots like hedges or bushes to feel comfortable.1* Igor has found his home in the backyard of Bültenweg 12. Like all other hedgehogs, Igor is nocturnal. Today he had a bad dream and wakes up very sleepy in his pile of leaves.

walking.content: In winter, hedgehogs find too little food, which is why they hibernate from November to March.1* Igor has had difficulty building up a layer of fat so far, which is why he goes directly in search of food.

drinking.content: Soon Igor has found a puddle from which he drinks thirstily. But what is lying in the water? Fact check: "Every year, 4.5 trillion cigarette butts from smoked cigarettes end up in the environment worldwide. Often only the plastic-coated filter remains from a smoked cigarette. This contains almost 4,000 chemical substances, many of which are toxic."1* In Berlin, researchers calculated 2.7 million cigarette butts per square kilometer. Rainwater dissolves more than half of the remaining toxins still in the cigarettes within half an hour. Wastewater treatment plants can largely break down the nicotine in the water, but around 70 percent of nicotine-containing rainwater ends up directly in bodies of water.2* "An experiment by US zoologist Thomas Novotny from San Diego State University illustrates the toxicity: The researcher added one cigarette butt to one liter of water and let fish swim in it. After four days, half of the animals were dead."3*

nightWalk.content: Igor continues to search for something edible. His sense of smell is very good.1* So he follows his nose and waddles towards the organic waste.

smoking.content: Jonas steps out into the backyard for a smoke. He lights a cigarette and takes a deep drag. Smoking is still very common in Germany. Around 28% of all Germans smoke regularly. On average, a smoker consumes around 12 cigarettes a day. Each cigarette produces around 14 grams of waste, including the cigarette butt, packaging, and lighter. This adds up to around 6 kilograms of waste per year per smoker.3* Jonas exhales the smoke and watches as the smoke swirls in the cold air.

onFence.content: Tabea lands on a fence. Plants grow all around and tickle her claws. From here she can see everything…

cigaretteFind.content: Down in the puddle lies something strange. It is long, soft and a bit dirty.

smokingDove.content: Tabea pecks at it carefully. Quickly she flies back up to the fence to take a closer look. This could be good for a nest!

chill.content: With the find in her beak, she flies back to her tree to put it in her hiding place. Now for a break…

hungry.content: Tabea's stomach is growling. She would do anything for a little beetle right now…

searchesFood.content: Fortunately, Tabea knows a place where there is always something to eat. You just have to search a little…

bugRunAway.content:
A beetle crawls out from between the pipes. Tabea's eyes widen. But the beetle spots her and in the next second it has disappeared. But not with Tabea…

Fearlessly, she throws herself headfirst after it.

stuck.content: Oh great! Suddenly nothing works anymore. Tabea is stuck. It rustles and crackles around her. The plastic pulls at her wings.

dizzy.content: After a long struggle, Tabea tumbles back out of the pipe. She is confused, her feathers standing out wildly from her body.

dizzyFly.content: Confused, Tabea flies on. Her nest absolutely must be finished.

takeOff.content: Tabea flies off. She wants to build a nest for the very first time — but no one has shown her how to do it. What actually belongs in a nest? Below her lies the backyard full of things. Some sparkle, some have a scent. Maybe there's something here.

markers.smokingManDescription: Jonas smokes like 28% of all Germans.

dove.title: Tabea takes off.
